title: KHR_materials_volume glTF extension
description: glTF extension that defines the parameters for the volume of a material.

thicknessFactor.description: The thickness of the volume beneath the surface in meters. The value is relative to the local coordinate system of the mesh's node. A value greater than 0 turns the mesh into a volume with a homogeneous medium, enabling refraction, absorption and subsurface scattering. The actual value may be ignored by renderers that are able to derive the thickness from the mesh (ray tracer).
thicknessFactor.short_description: Thickness of the volume in meters.

thicknessTexture.description: A texture that defines the thickness of the volume, stored in the G channel. Will be multiplied by thicknessFactor.
thicknessTexture.short_description: Texture that defines the thickness of the volume, stored in the G channel.

attenuationDistance.description: Average distance in meters that light travels in the medium before interacting with a particle. The value is given in world space. When undefined, the value is assumed to be infinite.

attenuationColor.description: Color that white light turns into due to absorption when reaching the attenuation distance.

subsurfaceColor.description: Color perceived at the surface due to subsurface scattering.
